note: Fragments do not allow for an exact determination of the number of columns and lines

note.value: The complete order is given under Georgian NF 90
From the same original manuscript as the UTO Khanmeti Mravaltavi in Sinai Georgian NF M 90; f. 1 is the lower part of Georgian NF M 90, f. 25

Fragments identified so far are also found in Sinai Georgian 32, 57, and 33 (the so-called Sinuri Mravaltavi, one manuscript broken into three parts) as well as other homiletic collections of the type
Description of undertext by Jost Gippert, Bernard Outtier

Bibliography: A. Shanidze, Sinuri Mravaltavi 864 c'lisa (Tbilisi, 1959), p. 31-39 ; I. Abuladze, "Mravaltavi": Enis, ist'oriisa da mat'erialuri k'ult'uris inst'it'ut'is moambe 14, 1944, p. 279-288 / Shromebi 3 (Tbilisi, 1975), p. 69-78 ; M. van Esbroeck, Les plus anciens homéliaires géorgiens: Étude descriptive et historique (Louvain-La-Neuve, 1973), p. 122-123
